chunks.text: What's up guys, you guys are here in 11th video

So 1 like is enough for everyone's consistency
In today's video we will see about Semantic Tags
Because SEO is very important
And to understand the overall website structure
Search engines are very happy to see this structure
That means overall SEO of your website will be very good
If you use these tags
What are these tags, why are they there, how to use them
What are the benefits we will see in this video
Let's go to the computer screen
Let's roll the intro
So guys, first of all I would like to tell you about Semantic Tags
Here you can see that I have made a folder named Video 11
And here I have set the title of the index.html boilerplate template
And set the image of the h1 and I am going to preview it here
So this is the image, to explain a little bit
I will tell you what are Semantic Tags
Semantic Tags is a tool that tells the browser and web crawlers
Which wants to understand your website properly
And tells them what is the content of your website
And what is the purpose of the tag
Even if you don't use Semantic Tags in html
Then also your work will be done
It's not like if you don't use Semantic Tags
Then your website will not look good
You can do a good job designing your website
But we want to explain Google and Bing search engines
About our website
And if we explain them about our website
Then they will understand our website
And they will rank our website on Google, Bing
And respective search engines
And we want crawlers to understand our website
And we want that whoever wants to understand our website
They can understand it properly
There are many tags like header, nav, main, article, figure
These are all special tags in html
Which helps in structuring your website
Now if there is something in header
Then I know that it's header, it's top
If there is something in footer, then I will understand
That the website has started ending and the footer has started
This footer could have been div
But no, if I am using Semantic html
Then I will not make my navigation bar in span tag
This time I will not make my navigation bar in span tag
I will make my navigation bar in nav tag
So these kind of differences
Explain our search engines very well
About our website
So I will show you some examples of Semantic Tags
And I hope you understood what Semantic Tags are
Now there are download folders of our computer
So download folder is like
All the files of the world are in that folder
90% of your computer files are in download folder
But we should not do this
Some people go to the extent that they start
Spreading files in their local disk C
And some people keep files in system32
So if you spread your files
In your computer, then it definitely
Doesn't work in one way
But if you arrange your files in folders
If you want to keep secret files in a folder
Then you can put secret files
You can make a folder called do not open this
If you can put your files in it
It will be arranged in one way
You have arranged your images in one way
You have arranged your videos in one way
So to understand this, it will be better
That folder structure instead of
If you are spreading your files throughout the computer
You definitely don't want to spread your files
So I hope you understood why we use Semantic Tags
It is very good for SEO
I haven't used the word SEO yet
But SEO is a very important part of search engine optimization
To use Semantic Tags
So I make my website the way I make it
You use some special tags
For example, let's say I am making this website
I will comment out the image
What are Semantic Tags
I will make a navbar
First of all, I will say this is my website header
I will make a nav in this
I will make an unordered list
I am writing a lot of things
And this is my header
So anyone who comes to my website will understand
This is my header, home, about, contact
I can write whatever I want
This is my header, navbar, nav tags
I will write about here
And I will write contact here
So I wrote home, about and contact
So you understood this
Now if I want to make a footer
I will use main tag
And then I will write in footer
Copyright, CWH
And here I will write
All rights reserved
So here I have written
Copyright, all rights reserved
So I will cut this
And put it in main camera
So first my header, then main content, then footer
And here also, this is my header, this is my main content
So I arranged it in one way
Like you arrange your files in different folders
I arranged my HTML tags
So we understood about header tag
It is used to represent the top section of a web page
So here we will put article, which is the navigation menu
In nav tag
Article indicates a self-containing piece of content
Such as blog post or news article
If you put a self-contained piece of content, then put it in nav tag
Section, it represents a thematic grouping
So if one section is talking about one thing
Then the other section will talk about something else
Aside, means if anything is on one side, then it uses aside tag
So here, typically used for sidebars and content that is tangentially related to the main content
So here, typically used for sidebars and content that is tangentially related to the main content
Like what you can do on aside tag is
You can put a side note, about the author, you must have seen many blogs
In which it is written about the author
So you can put such things with aside tag
Then we have footer tag, I have told you about it
If you want to put copyright information or if you want to put some important links
Then you can put it in footer
After that, figure and ficcaption
If you want to use images, diagrams, charts
Then you can use figure and ficcaption
Main content area, like the main content area of our speech
We put it in main tag
Then time tag is also used to represent time related information
So you can use time tag, you can put date, time or anything in it
So I hope you have understood this thing
So these are used to enhance SEO
These are used to enhance SEO, to improve accessibility
And browsers want to take a decision about our page
Let us say there is a browser
That has created a new feature
That will read our content, like the feature in Edge
So browser can decide that I am only allowing the main content
Now think, if someone wants to read this page, how will they allow it?
Code with airy, home, code sys, you will not want to allow it
You will want to read the main content
So you will read the content, like html, semantic tags
html5 introduce, arrange, semantic tags
The first versions of html did not have semantic tags
Semantic tags were introduced from html5
And the most important reason to introduce semantic tags in html5
Is to arrange things
So that the content that is parsing
Or the content that is watching the content
Whether it is browser, crawler, google, bing, search engines
Or anyone who wants to generate a preview
Like you put a URL on twitter
If you want to generate a preview
You will want to understand your content
So if you want to understand your content
You will use semantic tags
Or this image is explaining that without semantic tags
If you write html like this, you will write like this
This image that you see, this is header
This is header, nav, this is aside
How to throw something aside, we will do it with css
Don't get confused, this is not used for styling
Because many people get confused that
This is not used to do things aside
You will have to style things with css
But here your content can be understood
Described, what is the main content, header or footer
That's why semantic tags were made
Semantic tags are not magic, they are made for accessibility
And to understand your content
Here are some examples that you can see
I have given you the example of header and footer tag
What will happen inside the header
Or you will put your navigation bar inside the header
And you will style it with css
I will show you a quick styling
But many people will be confused
If you want to horizontalize your navigation bar

So many things will happen in the upcoming videos

And I will see you next time
